title: Admin panel UI polish for settings layout, dropdowns, KPI cards, confirm dialog, header avatar, and footer placement

requirements.summary: Make the Settings view content area wider/taller and visually group Settings tabs inside a clearer rounded bordered container within AdminLayoutShell + SystemSettingsSection.
acceptanceCriteria: On the System Settings screen, the white content card is noticeably wider (reduced side margins) and taller (more internal padding/spacing), especially on mobile.
The tabs (Labels/Layout/Branding/Sharing/Backup) are contained within a rounded bordered container that looks intentional; active/inactive states remain clear.
No content is clipped/overlapped by the fixed header or fixed footer on common mobile sizes.

file_operations.description: Adjust the Settings (and other admin) content container spacing: reduce side padding on small screens, increase inner padding, and tune scroll-area top/bottom padding so the main white content card appears larger and never collides with the fixed header/footer.

Restyle the Tabs header area to sit inside a clearer rounded, bordered container (more intentional grouping) and increase vertical spacing/padding in Settings tab contents so the primary white card feels larger. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui Tabs/Card/ScrollArea).
Add/adjust a small set of global utility classes (only where needed) to support consistent spacing for admin settings containers without editing immutable shadcn ui component files.

requirements.summary: Fix Settings Select/dropdown readability and overlay stacking by standardizing trigger/content typography, padding, and z-index behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening a dropdown shows all options fully (no clipping), with readable contrast and font sizing.
Dropdown content overlays above nearby cards/containers correctly (no being hidden behind other elements).
The selected value inside the trigger remains readable on both light and gradient backgrounds.

file_operations.description: Update SelectTrigger/SelectContent usages to apply consistent font size/line height/padding and stronger z-index/overlay styling; ensure option rows are not clipped and the trigger value remains readable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui Select).
Add targeted CSS overrides for admin settings dropdown overlays (e.g., ensure Radix portal content stacks above fixed header/footer and card borders) without modifying frontend/src/components/ui/*.

requirements.summary: Increase contrast of the Worker & Rate Settings title and restyle inputs in WorkerRateSettingsSection to match the cleaner input style used elsewhere, including disabled/locked readability.
acceptanceCriteria: The "কর্মী ও রেট সেটিংস" title has clear contrast against its header background and is readable on mobile.
All inputs in WorkerRateSettingsSection have a consistent light background shade, consistent border thickness, and consistent focus state.
Disabled/locked inputs remain visually distinct but still readable.

file_operations.description: Restyle the CardHeader/CardTitle contrast and apply consistent Input classNames (background, border, focus ring) for new worker name and rate inputs; ensure locked/disabled state remains readable and visually distinct. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui Card/Input/Table/Checkbox).

Add reusable admin input styling utilities (light background, border, focus ring) to keep WorkerRateSettingsSection and similar settings inputs consistent without editing immutable UI component sources.

requirements.summary: Add a right-aligned circular profile avatar in AdminLayoutShell header using stored profile photo when available, otherwise a placeholder.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin header shows a circular avatar on the right side on all admin screens using AdminLayoutShell.
If a profile photo exists for the current user/admin identity, it is displayed; otherwise a placeholder avatar is shown.
Header layout remains stable: title truncates gracefully and the avatar does not overlap buttons/text.

file_operations.description: Create a small header avatar component that reads the current session identity (user vs admin), loads the stored profile photo via the existing localStorage approach, and falls back to the generated placeholder image. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui styling conventions where applicable).

Wire the new AdminHeaderAvatar into the fixed header right side for all AdminLayoutShell screens, ensuring proper spacing with optional headerActions and stable truncation of the title/back button row.

Extend the existing profile photo getter usage pattern to support a consistent key for admin (fallback identity) while keeping the same storage approach (localStorage data URL), without introducing backend image serving.

requirements.summary: Reposition/restyle fixed bottom action buttons as a clean floating bar above content and ensure scrollable content has adequate bottom spacing.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer does not cover important content at the bottom of pages; last form controls remain accessible without being hidden.
Footer buttons look intentionally placed (consistent spacing, rounded container, readable labels) and do not clash with underlying card borders.
Behavior remains fixed/sticky at bottom during scroll.

file_operations.description: Restyle the footer as a rounded, floating action bar (remove internal fixed positioning, add outer rounded container, consistent border/shadow, and safe-area padding) so it can be positioned cleanly by parent shells.
Adjust the fixed footer wrapper to position the floating bar above content (with margins) and update the scroll container bottom padding so the last content is never obscured by the floating footer.
Update dashboard view footer usage to match the new floating DashboardFooter (parent owns fixed positioning) and tune dashboard scroll bottom padding to maintain access to the last tiles/cards.
Add a small global utility (if needed) for consistent 'floating footer bar' spacing and safe-area bottom padding so multiple admin views behave consistently.

requirements.summary: Restyle AdminSummaryCards numeric readout to remove the stark white patch and use a cohesive high-contrast display/screen look across all 3 cards.
acceptanceCriteria: In AdminSummaryCards, the number area no longer appears as a stark white patch; it reads like a cohesive display element.
Text remains highly readable in all three cards (Due/Work/Taken) on mobile.
Borders/radius/shadow remain consistent with the dashboard style constants where applicable.

file_operations.description: Replace the inner 'bg-white/90' number block styling with a cleaner display/screen readout (cohesive translucent/darkened panel, subtle border, optional backdrop blur, consistent typography) across Due/Work/Taken while preserving existing dashboardBorders constants.
If needed, extend/update shared KPI inner styling constants to support the new display-like readout styling consistently across KPI cards.

requirements.summary: Update shared ConfirmDialog styling to a rounder, vibrant colorful look with clear button hierarchy and correct mobile stacking.
acceptanceCriteria: ConfirmDialog has noticeably rounder corners and a more colorful, polished header/body styling while keeping text readable.
Primary/confirm and cancel buttons are clearly distinguished and remain at least 44px tall for touch.
Dialog content is centered and not clipped on mobile; overlay stacking remains correct.

file_operations.description: Restyle AlertDialogContent/Header/Footer to a round-shaped, vibrant theme (Bangladesh-style colorful accents), improve spacing/typography, and ensure overlay/z-index behavior is correct on mobile. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui AlertDialog).
Add minimal global styles (if needed) to ensure dialog overlay/content stacks above fixed headers/footers and remains readable on small screens without modifying frontend/src/components/ui/*.

requirements.summary: Add generated default avatar placeholder asset and wire it into the admin header avatar fallback as a static frontend asset.
acceptanceCriteria: The placeholder avatar file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced directly by the frontend for fallback rendering.
No backend endpoints are added for serving images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated placeholder avatar image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/admin-avatar-placeholder.dim_128x128.png for static serving by the frontend build.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/admin-avatar-placeholder.dim_128x128.png as the fallback image when no stored profile photo exists. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
